alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 3:01PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN FAYETTE AND NORTHWESTERN HARDEMAN COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CST... At 301 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Somerville, or 15 miles east of Collierville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Bolivar, Whiteville, Somerville, Macon, Moscow, Williston, Hickory Valley, Laconia, Hays Crossing, Pattersonville, and Middleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for west Tennessee.
